Class Blocks

java.lang.Object
Blocks
public class Blocks extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Blocks()
    This constructs a Blocks object without initiating the number and miner variables.
    Blocks(int number)
    This constructs a Blocks object.
    Blocks(int number, String miner)
    This constructs a Blocks object and initiates the variables number and miner.

  • Constructor Details

    • Blocks

      public Blocks()
      This constructs a Blocks object without initiating the number and miner variables.

    • Blocks

      public Blocks(int number)
      This constructs a Blocks object. It initiates the number variable but does not initiate the miner variable
      Parameters:
      number -

    • Blocks

      public Blocks(int number, String miner)
      This constructs a Blocks object and initiates the variables number and miner.
      Parameters:
      number - The number that identifies which block we are referring to
      miner - The address of the block

  • Method Details

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber()
      Returns the number associated with a block object.
      Returns:
      The number used to identify a block

    • getMiner

      public String getMiner()
      Returns the miner associated with a block.
      Returns:
      The miner address

    • getBlocks

      public static ArrayList<Blocks> getBlocks()
      Creates and returns a copy of the ArrayList blocks
      Returns:
      A copy of blocks ArrayList

    • calUniqMiners

      public static void calUniqMiners()
      Counts the number of unique miner addresses and prints the frequency that that each miner address occurs in the data file.

    • blockDiff

      public static int blockDiff(Blocks A, Blocks B)
      Returns the difference between two block numbers.
      Parameters:
      A - Block A
      B - Block B
      Returns:
      The int value of the difference between Block A's number and Block B's number

      Parameters:

      Returns:
